channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Both 'Churchfields Road' street name plates need attention at the junction with Beckenham Rd. Beckenham., 28th September
item.description:
Both 'Churchfields Road' street name plates need attention at the junction with Beckenham Rd. Beckenham. One is just tilted and needs levelling. The other is bent about 30 degrees in the middle and one of the short poles appears to have been impact damaged.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Churchfields Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant Misuse and Unapproved Structural/Usage Changes of Warehouses, 28th September
item.description:
Piled up rubbish and unkept forecourts of warehouses. The street is becoming increasingly like a tip. This warehouse has put up illegal cladding and structures to extend their space. Rubbish is everywhere on the street Warehouse opposite is a school

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Grosvenor Way, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sign on pavement is falling over, 28th September
item.description:
This sign is at junction of Bessborough Street and Bessborough Place. It leans over at a strange angle and needs to be re-set in the pavement. The issue dates back several years and was also reported in Oct 2023 reference either 148296 or 148297.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Bessborough Place, Millbank, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned trailer and fly tipping by 69/71 Swallowfield Road, 28th September
item.description:
Trailer has been outside 69/71 Swallowfield Road on a single yellow line for months now. It has a flat tyre and is being held up by a log on the other side. Rubbish is accumulating around it as I assume others are fly tipping around it. I am concerned my children may hurt themselves on the dumped items or on the trailer itself as it doesn’t look safe. Hopefully it belongs to someone and they can move it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Swallowfield Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown trees, 28th September
item.description:
Overgrown trees shielding light from lampposts. Very dark an cannot see uneven pavement, causing a trip hazard and very dangerous to elderly or disabled

item.title: Reduced visibility., 28th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Davis Way, North Cray, London

item.title: There is dumped rubbish on the grass verge that is still outside 32 Reddy Road., 28th September
item.description:
